summary: An FBI Miami Division request to the Palm Springs Resident Agency to interview Michael D. Friedman, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, regarding potential witness testimony about Epstein's interactions with underage girls. The document also references an obstruction of justice case against another former employee, Rodriguez, for attempting to sell victim information.

persons.name: Michael D. Friedman
persons.role: Former housekeeper/property manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who may have witnessed Epstein's interactions with underage girls and criminal conduct. The FBI is requesting an interview with him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused sex offender, subject of criminal investigation
persons.context: The subject of a child prostitution investigation. He entered a non-prosecution agreement, pled guilty to state offenses, served prison time, and completed community supervision in July 2010.

persons.name: Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Was deposed in civil litigation by victims' attorney Bradley Edwards. Later attempted to sell lists of additional Epstein victims for $50,000, leading to an obstruction of justice case.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Represented several of Epstein's victims in civil litigation and deposed Rodriguez.

connections.description: Friedman worked for Epstein as a housekeeper or property manager at one of his properties.
Rodriguez was the previous house manager and butler to Epstein in Palm Beach.
Rodriguez was deposed by attorney Bradley Edwards, who represented Epstein's victims in civil litigation.

events.title: FBI Investigation of Epstein Begins
events.description: Miami Division began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Rodriguez, Epstein's former butler.

events.title: Rodriguez Attempts to Sell Victim Information
events.description: Rodriguez attempted to sell lists of additional Epstein victims to an unidentified party for $50,000.

events.title: Epstein Completes Community Supervision
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein completed his state-mandated community supervision as a registered sex offender.

events.title: FBI Requests Interview of Michael Friedman
events.description: FBI Miami Division formally requested the Palm Springs RA to interview former Epstein employee Michael D. Friedman.

keyFacts: A former Epstein butler/house manager, Rodriguez, attempted to sell lists of additional Epstein victims for $50,000 in 2009, leading to an FBI obstruction of justice case.
The FBI was seeking to interview Michael D. Friedman, a former Epstein housekeeper/property manager, as a potential witness to Epstein's interactions with underage girls.
Jeffrey Epstein had completed his state prison sentence and community supervision as a registered sex offender by July 2010.
Epstein maintained residences in multiple international locations including New York, Palm Beach, the U.S. Virgin Islands, New Mexico, London, and Paris.
The document indicates ongoing FBI interest in Epstein's activities and witnesses years after his non-prosecution agreement and state conviction.
